poem:
"Unpaid Hopes"

Echoes of youth in the marketplace,
bogus traineeships, dangling like ripe pears.
How the hopeful reach, hands grasping at air.
A song of silent wages sings in a Brussels square.
Under the shadow of the imminent June,
the EU sculpts laws with a stern, paternal frown.
But in the chorus of the jobless, it is drowned,
the melody of promises, unpaid and unpound.
